subject: CBS Evening News with Katie Couric E-Mail Alert
body:

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours
    | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday
    Morning | Face The
    Nation 















Hi everyone,
 
There's a new generation of terrorists who have
  learned and mastered their trade in Afghanistan
  and Iraq,
  and are now being told they are ready to go into the world. They are trained
  in war, committed to destruction and some intelligence analysis says they could
  be headed our way. Sheila MacVicar will have our exclusive report.
 
In Iraq,
  the al Maliki government is facing serious trouble — from the inside.
  Lara Logan will have the story.
 
There was a final salute today in Charleston, South Carolina,
  as firefighters from around the country gathered at the memorial service for
  nine firemen killed in a massive furniture-storeroom blaze. Mark Strassmann was
  at the emotional memorial.
  
Interesting new research says that birth order might
  affect your intelligence. Eldest boys in families tend to develop slightly
  higher IQs than their younger siblings. Kelly Wallace will report on these
  controversial findings.
 
Anyone who's picked up a video game controller knows
  there's something about certain games that can suck you in. But does rampant
  video game playing qualify as an addiction for young people? Daniel Sieberg
  will report on what the American Medical Association has to say on the
  subject.
 
Finally, for this week's special Assignment America,
  Steve Hartman will meet a man who's got a hobby that's straight out of
  Curious George. Join us to watch him go up, up and away.
 
Have a great weekend!
 




Katie Couric
CouricandCo@cbs.com
